reviews.review: After the bad taste left behind after The Last Jedi, the Rise of Skywalker was a return to the Star Wars that I remember as a child.

It was a beautifully shot, well acted steaming pile of garbage... 
So much is wrong with this movie i don't even know where to start. 
From the sudden "somehow" return of palpatine to the multiple pointless love stories, to the near constant fan service character call backs this movie is seriously bad. It spends half its time walking back the plot of last jedi and the other half on a wild chase for an object they dont end up even using. It feels rushed packing too much into too little time.  
Its not all bad though... It has its moments. But ultimately had me leaving the theatre slightly irritated

It's a convoluted mess in a rush to fix the perceived mistakes of Last Jedi. Characters are not developed, or are sacrificed with little meaning or explanation. The whole story line seems rushed and jumpy. The finale keeps compounding and ends with little payoff. It felt as if the writers were trying to mirror the climax of Avengers Endgame without the audience investment in the characters. The story is missing the heart and soul of the original trilogy. Maybe the ending of this story line is a blessing.  Now writers and directors can concentrate on telling a good, original story instead of trying to catch the "lightning in a bottle" of the first trilogy. At least the Mandolorian is awesome.
Epicness! Mind blowing! Can’t trust rating now in days!!!!

Beautiful cinematography that's nostalgic of the prequels plus some new envisioned sequences that are a delight to see on the big screen in IMAX 3D.  Chaotically ridiculous storyline, overly-dramatized fight/ battle scenes that break continuity with the original 6 films, and a whimsicle ending that makes you relieved that this poorly put-together trilogy is FINALLY over...  .
Great epic ending to the 45 year saga! Can't wait to see what's next!
Schwache erste Hälfte, gute zweite. Sehr vorhersehbarer Plot, und ein großer Schwung mit der Nostalgiekeule.

I've been a Star Wars diehard my entire life since I was a child. I am almost 40 years old and i'll say this movie had everything I love about Star Wars. The story was good from start to finish, the action was great and the performances were incredible. The cinematography was beautiful. I felt the ending was appropriate for the Saga and I was satisfied.
I really enjoyed this movie! It wasn't perfect and could have been 30 minutes longer. However, it was a fun movie and a good time at the cinema.
